intro: Phaeanthus schefferi, commonly known as the Scheffers' phaeanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
